definition: to criticize harshly/to denounce/to attack viciously
to blame/to reprove/to reprimand/to expel/to oust/to reconnoiter/(of territory) to expand/saline marsh

sentences.english: And here I am ranting against somebody that doesn't have a chance to respond.
sentences.chinese: 并且在这里我还要痛斥那些此时无法作出回应的人。

sentences.english: 'The president is outraged and has ordered an impartial investigation, ' Mr. Remonde said.
sentences.chinese: 雷蒙迪说，阿罗约总统痛斥暴行，下令彻查。

sentences.english: After they beat him up for four days he announced he would stay on.
sentences.chinese: 他们对他痛斥了四天之后，斯塔尔宣布他将留职。

sentences.english: The speaker stood on a table, reviling at the evil doings of the reactionaries.
sentences.chinese: 那位演讲者站在桌上痛斥反动派的罪恶行径。

sentences.english: Did he turn on the people and scold them?
sentences.chinese: 又或，他是否忿然痛斥百姓一顿？

sentences.english: The press denounces clandestine support for the counterrevolution.
sentences.chinese: 新闻界痛斥了对反革命的暗中支持。

sentences.english: He is reviled for his Watergate lies.
sentences.chinese: 他就是因水门事件而被痛斥的。

sentences.english: Now we have denounced the etiquette, trying to get rid of all of the detention.
sentences.chinese: 现在的我们痛斥礼数，试图摆脱所有的禁锢。

sentences.english: When David was confronted about his sin, he made no excuses.
sentences.chinese: 当大卫被当面痛斥其罪时，他并没有藉词推搪。

sentences.english: When she broke the dish her father really jumped on her.
sentences.chinese: 她打碎盘子时，她父亲很生气地痛斥了她一顿。

definition: to criticize/to find fault with/to denounce
to accuse/to denounce/to make a complaint against/denunciation
righteous indignation fills one's breast (idiom); to feel indignant at injustice
to rain curses (on sb)/to let sb have it/to bawl sb out
variant of 污衊|污蔑[wu1 mie4]
